definition: to go one's own way (idiom); to act independently without asking others
alone/independent/single/sole/only

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
each one does what he thinks is right (idiom)/each goes his own way
to bear one's own responsibilities and not pass them to others (idiom)
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to envy the virtuous and talented (idiom)
straightforward and honest in one's actions (idiom)
to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
to stir up trouble at every opportunity (idiom)
to reject/to dismiss
see 咎由自取[jiu4 you2 zi4 qu3]
to be fawningly submissive (idiom)
to violate/to go against
appointment to an important post
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to practice favoritism
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
